newsitem.title: USA: U.S. spot resid prices steady to up, LSFO gains.
newsitem.headline: U.S. spot resid prices steady to up, LSFO gains.

text.p: U.S. spot residual fuel prices were steady to up again Monday in sluggish trade, with some low sulphur interest boosting those grades despite the sharp slide in crude, industry sources said.
"Resid feels pretty well supported. Even if crude moves down a little more, prices may hold," said one East Coast utility source.
But most agreed slack generation demand and more competitive gas prices should limit the upside.
In New York Harbor, physical one percent edged up slightly to $16.25-50 a barrel, traders said.
